content.description: The original start begins on two crimp side pulls, but the start holds and feet tend to be wet, so you may have to start in the next couple holds. Pull through the crimps into nice positive holds, then lean back on gastons. Then fight through slopers near the end.
content.location: O.B.D. Area (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description:
Start on two small thunderclings with horrible feet, throw for the jug. Traverse right and up through the jugs

 NOTE: The start holds to this problem likely broke sometime after its 03/20/09 FA, making it harder.The best guess based on the first ascensionist’s opinion and the (only?) 2 other ascents of the Pre-Break version put its difficulty at ~V9.The first ascensionist of the original Young Thugs repeated the Post-Break version on 10/30/20 and proposed a tentative grade of V11 (as well as the name “Cum Thugz”).Additionally, while the Pre-Break version was a drop off problem from the jug ledge out right, the newly re-opened Post-Break version tops out the entire boulder (via V0- jug hauling).Also, this is not a jump start, but starting from a 2 (or more) pad stack is totally legit. As long as you establish on the start (first crux) before thrutching to the jug pocket (second crux), you’re golden. Due to the way-more-subjective-than-normal nature of one move wonders, grade opinions for this problem would be much appreciated.
content.location: Just south down the hill  of lovely tower, past the cool looking section with the horizontal seems.

content.description: Huge, grand, stunning. Walk your way up the perfect slab.
content.protection: No. Kind of a do not fall situation.
content.location: The huge boulder around the corner from Body Karate, about halfway down the canyon. Look for the massive, clean, sheer slabby face.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug and dyno to the chalked up sloper.
content.location: Can't remember exact location. Feel free to edit.

content.description: Fun little boulder problem! Sit start matched on rail, find feet and work your way up. Many variations exist. You can also work left onto the Arete which is fun as well. If there is another name for this please make the change. You can toss your shoes up and put them on, on top so you don’t have to walk through all the moss and mud.
content.location: About 100 yards past the Yosemite slab just off the trail on your left.

content.description: Sit start beneath the arete on underclings. Work your way up the arete and to the right using any means necessary. Take note of the large hueco at foot level to the right. The rock the boulder is sitting on is fair game.Dabbing on the small rock to the right is mandatory.
content.location: In the South Canyon, at the Industry wall, on the boulder to the right of Industry 12a.

content.description: Begin matched on jug, do a few moves up on crimps, then left into the arête and up.
content.location: Reefer Madness Area (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description: Start on crimps under the small roof, paste your feet and fire to the sloper lip. Establish your left hand on undercling, then try to figure out a way to mantle!
content.protection: Pads + Spotter (DON'T FALL INTO THE WATER)
content.location: Creek Boulders (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description: Work your way up the right arête of the Yosemite slab.0
content.location: Right side of the Yosemite slab.

content.description: Sit start. Begin with left in positive pocket, your in one of the few shallow two finger pockets. Fire your way up to slopey crimps, then into the slopers at top. Fantastic mantle at top.
content.location: O.B.D. Area (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description: A fun 5 move problem that starts on the upper portion of the rail. Starts on two crimps with the left foot pasted on the lower rail and the right foot heel hooked on the side of the boulder. Reach high left for good crimp. Switch feet onto the rail. Reach out right for sloper on right corner of the boulder. Heel hook up high left by left hand. Find right hand crimp on top and sloper on left and top out.   It's a fun short problem with the crux being the top out portion up the front of the boulder.
content.protection: 1 crash pad will do. Two would be better.
content.location: This problem is located in a large cave opening left of a small waterfall just past The Gallery with Battle Axe Tower slightly further down the trail.

content.description: Begin with a sit start under the the Body Karate boulder, throw to the lip and traverse right and finish on Body Karate.
content.location: Same boulder as Body Karate, but the side closer to Yosemite slab.

content.description: Start low on flake (same start as Berlier Problem), move up left.
content.location: Creek Boulders (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description: Just go straight up that corner from a sit start.
content.location: About 3 ft right of wolverine.

content.description: Start with your left hand on undercling crimp, and your right hand undercling pinch. Establish feet, then catch crimp and finish.
content.location: Starts left side of the face that David and Goliath is on.

content.description: Start with left hand on a crimp side pull, right on lowest chalked ledge. Catch thumdercling, adjust and huck for the lip.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the face that Body Karate is on.

content.description: Start on slopers, travers right on arête then pull yourself over the lip.
content.location: Starts at the end of Body Karate and Hypoglycemia.

content.description: A powerful and beautiful roof compression problem. It starts with a couple of big throws, then some compression with tensiony, far away feet, and finishes with hero climbing on an awesome rail.    If you always wanted to climb The Vice, but don't climb v13 or can't get to Africa, this is your problem.   Arguably the best boulder problem in the canyon, and good enough that it stands out in the region.   Feels v9 to some body types.
content.protection: 2 big pads from Organic were perfect for us.
content.location: This problem is located underneath the boulder just uphill from Yosemite Slab (v0-ish). Look for the steep compression problem leading to a beautiful finish rail.    Start on the undercling about 5 feet deep under the roof. There will be an obvious, left-facing foot rail. I started with my left hand in the good part, my right hand in the undercling that was left over, left toe in the foot rail, and shot right hand out to the rail.

content.description: Start low, matched on flake, then move right to a juggy gaston, then pull up.
content.location: Creek Boulders (see Sandstone Warrior guide book for more details)

content.description: Start on two underclings. Work up through two finger pocket and sloped rail. Get to jug rail and finish by turning on to the slab to the right or left. Have fun!!
content.protection: Depends how confident you are on the slab top-out. 1-5 pads.
content.location: On the slightly overhung face of Yosemite Slab boulder facing the trail.

content.description: This is the best I could do with the limited info from Vertical Heartland 3:At Large starts just left of Wolverine on some chest height chalky pockets. From the start there are "random problems" from V1-V4. For all of these, the crux is the topout (you'll see why as soon as you try to... topout) so I'm guessing the easier variations avoid the topout while the V3-V4 stuff includes the topout.The right variation (dubbed by me) goes to the right, up, then right again on sculpted pockets to a final juggy pocket (do this move the Jungle Book way for extra style points). A deadpoint from here to the slopey lip sets you up for the topout. I was unable to do the direct topout after many tries, so I made a big span to the chicken head by Wolverine and topped out using the positive crimps over there. This was clearly not the absolute hardest topout variation, so that's why I'm calling it just V3.
content.location: On Reefer Madness Boulder, two problems left of the popular arete (Ghetto Life).

pathTokens: Z. Bouldering in the Canyon Proper

content.description: Enter a description of this area.
